alert.note: Alert for Elko (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 24 at 11:38AM PDT until further notice by NWS Elko
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Elko has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Nevada... Humboldt River Near Elko affecting Elko County. For the Upper Humboldt...including Elko...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flooding caused by snowmelt is expected. * WHERE...Humboldt River Near Elko. * WHEN...From this morning until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 5.5 feet, Action Stage - no impacts seen. At 6.2 feet, Minor Flood Stage - Minor lowland flooding occurs upstream and downstream of Elko. Very minor flooding from backed up storm drains begins in Elko, especially in the parking lots on Water Street between 7th and 9th Streets. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:25 AM PDT Wednesday the stage was 5.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to 6.0 feet Sunday afternoon. Additional rises are possible thereafter. - Action stage is 5.5 feet. - Flood stage is 6.2 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued tomorrow after 1145 AM PDT.
